title: A Phase I, Randomized, Double-blind (with-in Panel), Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of AZD0328 in Healthy Elderly Volunteers After Oral Multiple Ascending Doses of AZD0328
description_brief: The primary purpose of this study is to investigate the safety and tolerability of AZD0328 following once-daily dosing for 13 days in elderly healthy volunteers and to define maximum tolerated dose.
drug: AZD0328 (α7 nicotinic acetylcholine receptor agonist/partial agonist)
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests AZD0328 in healthy elderly volunteers to assess safety/tolerability and PK/PD rather than a disease‑modifying biomarker or pathology endpoint. AZD0328 is an agonist of the α7 nicotinic acetylcholine receptor, a target pursued to improve cognition in Alzheimer’s and schizophrenia, which fits the definition of a cognitive enhancer. citeturn0search3turn0search2

Act: Key extracted details — drug name AZD0328; intervention: oral multiple ascending doses once daily for 13 days; population: healthy elderly volunteers; phase: Phase I (safety/tolerability, MTD). AZD0328 is described in preclinical and clinical sources as an α7 nAChR agonist/partial agonist developed by AstraZeneca with cognition-enhancing intent. citeturn0search0turn0search3turn0search2

Reflect: Classification check — AZD0328 is a small‑molecule receptor agonist intended to modulate cholinergic neurotransmission and enhance cognition rather than a biologic targeting amyloid/tau or an intervention for neuropsychiatric symptoms. Therefore the correct category is 'cognitive enhancer'. Clinical pharmacology reports and preclinical studies specifically link AZD0328 to cognitive effects. citeturn0search3turn0search2

explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug AZD0328 is an agonist/partial agonist of the α7 nicotinic acetylcholine receptor (a ligand-gated cholinergic neurotransmitter receptor) and was developed to enhance cognition rather than to modify core AD pathologies such as amyloid or tau. This aligns with CADRO's category for interventions acting on neurotransmitter receptors. citeturn0search3turn0search0

Because the mechanism is direct modulation of a neurotransmitter receptor (cholinergic α7 nAChR), the most specific CADRO match is D) Neurotransmitter Receptors. citeturn0search2turn0search1
